page.title: 18Gravel Works, Powburn
page.content:
There are two gravel works in our block of land. We went to visit one of them at Low Hedgeley.The gravel is quarried up the valley of the River Breamish at Roddam. It is brought down to Low Hedgeley by lorry and processed there.
The gravel is called 'ballast' before it has been processed. This is when it is mixed with coarse sand and other materials. First it is put in the 'feed box'. It is screened and graded for different sizes of gravel.
At Low Hedgeley there are five workers on the site and five drivers. Sand and gravel are supplied to the building trade. When we were there, loads were going off to Newcastle to build a new football stand at St James's Park.
